CatDescriptText: Mr. Eugene W. Key, 2137 Brighton Road, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I think that it's because of crime, and crime is the result of Negroes being crowded together in small areas."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Eugene W. Key wearing small moustache and light colored shirt with rolled sleeves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, May Building in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
